decks.notes: This deck focuses on ramping up quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Emrakul. It also utilizes control elements like Chalice of the Void and Kozilek's Return to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Through the Breach allows for cheating out big creatures ahead of schedule, while cards like Yggdrasil and Nulldrifter provide card advantage. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with massive threats while keeping them on the back foot with disruptive spells.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan through counter spells, hand disruption, removal, and card advantage. It aims to gradually gain control of the game by efficiently dealing with threats, disrupting the opponent's resources, and deploying powerful threats like Murktide Regent. The deck utilizes a mix of removal, counter spells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent and ultimately win the game through incremental advantage and resource management. The key strategy is to control the board state and tempo of the game while gradually wearing down the opponent's resources.

The deck focuses on using cards like Song of Creation and Malevolent Rumble to generate a large amount of mana and draw through the deck quickly. The main win condition is to cast Grapeshot or Strike It Rich multiple times in a turn to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck includes cards like Cache Grab and Mishra's Bauble to dig for combo pieces, while also running Pact of Negation for protection. The mana base includes a mix of lands to ensure consistent access to different colors of mana needed for the combo.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. Utilizing powerful cards like Blood Moon, Lightning Bolt, and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and maintain it throughout. Cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer provide additional threats, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Thraben Charm help to control the board and protect our creatures. With a mix of removal spells, powerful creatures, and aggressive strategies, this deck aims to take down opponents swiftly and decisively.

The archetype of this deck is centered around assembling a specific combination of creatures to generate powerful synergies and advantages. By utilizing creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Grist, the Hunger Tide in conjunction with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling, this deck aims to create a toolbox of versatile creatures that can be searched for and deployed as needed. The inclusion of various utility creatures like Blood Artist and Hapatra, Vizier of Poisons further enhances the combo potential of the deck, allowing for explosive plays and efficient board control.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Counterspells, while utilizing graveyard interaction with Unearth and Thought Scour to maximize card advantage. The deck also includes a strong removal package with Fatal Push and Sink into Stupor. The win condition lies in controlling the board with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog, eventually overwhelming the opponent with efficient threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency.

This deck focuses on using Indomitable Creativity to cheat in powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and combo pieces like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. It utilizes cards like Persist and Faithless Looting to set up the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The mana base is designed to support the combo pieces and ensure consistency. Overall, the deck aims to be a creative and unique combo archetype that can catch opponents off guard and win through explosive plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing the card Indomitable Creativity to cheat out powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty early in the game. The deck also includes cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Wrenn and Six to provide additional value and flexibility. The inclusion of Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and clear the way for the combo to go off. Overall, the deck aims to be creative in its approach to generating powerful synergies and overwhelming the opponent with unexpected plays.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the combo of Splinter Twin and Deceiver Exarch to create infinite creature tokens, allowing for a game-winning attack. The deck also includes disruptive elements such as Counterspell and Lightning Bolt to control the game until the combo can be assembled. Additionally, the deck features efficient card draw and selection spells like Preordain and Expressive Iteration to help find key pieces of the combo. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly bringing out powerful creatures like Hollow One and Dragon's Rage Channeler to put pressure on the opponent. By using cards like Faithless Looting and Burning Inquiry, the deck can quickly cycle through the deck to find key cards and fill up the graveyard to enable cheap casting costs. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive plays, while also utilizing cards like Fatal Push to control the board and maintain tempo. The deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to set up their own strategy.
